title.narrative: ECD POLICY AND PLANS

description.narrative: Strengthened national frameworks, policies, plans and standards to increase access to high-quality, equitable, inclusive, and holistic early childhood development, learning and care environments for girls and boys (ages 0-8) and their families by 2021, including in emergencies., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Cross-Sectoral - Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Early Learning, Education In Emergencies, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence (Covid), Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement, Maternal And Newborn Health, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition In Early Childhood (Covid), Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, the most disadvantaged boys, girls and adolescents improved their education and developmental outcomes and access equitable and inclusive learning environments across the life cycle, including in emergencies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened national frameworks, policies, plans and standards to increase access to high-quality, equitable, inclusive, andholistic early childhood development, learning and care environments for girls and boys (ages 0-8) and their families by 2021,including in emergencies.

description.narrative: This output reflects UNICEF’s strengthening of national frameworks, policies, plans and standards to increase access to high-quality, equitable, inclusive, and holistic early childhood development, learning and care environments for girls and boys (ages 0-8) and their families by 2021, including in emergencies. The CO directly supported parenting programs to ensure that parents/caregivers of children under 5 can improve responsive caregiving and the development of their children. Support was also provided for early stimulation practices with an aim to end violence against children. ;With UNICEF’s contribution, the Government of Belize committed to reimagining ECD with increased investment in the early years. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022
